title: Analysis of f from a graph of f' part - c

content.description: The figure above shows the graph of f', the derivative of a twice-differentiable function f, on the interval [–3, 4]. The graph of f' has horizontal tangents at x = –1, x = 1, and x = 3. The areas of the regions bounded by the x-axis and the graph of f' on the intervals [–2, 1] and [1, 4] are 9 and 12, respectively.
content.question: Find the x-coordinates of all points of inflection for the graph of f. Give a reason for your answer.

frqParts.text: Find the x-coordinates of all points of inflection for the graph of f. Give a reason for your answer.

topic.text: 5.9: Connecting a Function, Its First Derivative, and Its Second Derivative

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
